intro: Nemosenecio nikoensis f. albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered alpine gentian, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its foliage consists of basal, spoon-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
